fr222cy_assign3.graphs

Class Node<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr222cy_assign3.graphs.Node<E>

  • public abstract class Node<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract Node class that serves as an interface for nodes of the DirectedGraph interface. Each node is aware of (and stores) all its successor and predecessor nodes.

    This class also defines a set of protected methods that can be used to add and remove adjacent nodes. They should only be used by implementors of the DirectedGraph interface. Reason: improper use of these methods may put the graph in an inconsistent state. For example, by removing A as successor of B without removing B as predecessor of A.

    The public integer field num is introduced to avoid externally constructed mappings between the node and some integer (e.g. a dfs number). It should only be used internally and never be a part of any public interface since its interpretation might be changed from one algorithm to another.
    Author:
    jonasl
